refs.DefaultDetection$Count: The total number of occurrences of the type of sensitive data that was detected.
refs.Finding$Count: The total number of occurrences of the finding. For sensitive data findings, this value is always 1. All sensitive data findings are considered new (unique) because they derive from individual classification jobs.
refs.GetBucketStatisticsResponse$Classifiable: The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the buckets. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.

The total storage size, in bytes, of all the objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the buckets. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.

If versioning is enabled for any of the buckets, Macie calculates this value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in those buckets. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of all applicable objects in the buckets.
refs.GetBucketStatisticsResponse$ObjectCount: The total number of objects in the buckets.
refs.GetBucketStatisticsResponse$SizeInBytes:
The total storage size, in bytes, of the buckets.

If versioning is enabled for any of the buckets, Macie calculates this value based on the size of the latest version of each object in those buckets. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of the objects in the buckets.
refs.GetBucketStatisticsResponse$SizeInBytesC:
The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that are compressed (.gz, .gzip, .zip) files in the buckets.

If versioning is enabled for any of the buckets, Macie calculates this value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in those buckets. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of the applicable objects in the buckets.
refs.GetInvitationsCountResponse$InvitationsC: The total number of invitations that were received by the account, not including the currently accepted invitation.
refs.GroupCount$Count: The total number of findings in the group of query results.
refs.MatchingBucket$ClassifiableObjectCount: The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
refs.MatchingBucket$ClassifiableSizeInBytes:
The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.

refs.ObjectCountByEncryptionType$KmsManaged: The total number of objects that are encrypted with an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) customer master key (CMK). The objects use AWS managed AWS KMS encryption (AWS-KMS) or customer managed AWS KMS encryption (SSE-KMS).
refs.ObjectCountByEncryptionType$S3Managed: The total number of objects that are encrypted with an Amazon S3 managed key. The objects use Amazon S3 managed encryption (SSE-S3).

refs.ObjectCountByEncryptionType$Unknown: The total number of objects that Amazon Macie doesn't have current encryption metadata for. Macie can't provide current data about the encryption settings for these objects.
refs.ObjectLevelStatistics$FileType: The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze because the objects don't have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
refs.ObjectLevelStatistics$StorageClass: The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze because the objects use an unsupported storage class.
refs.ObjectLevelStatistics$Total: The total storage size (in bytes) or number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze because the objects use an unsupported storage class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
refs.Page$PageNumber: The page number of the page that contains the data.
refs.Range$End:
Possible values are:

  • In an Occurrences.lineRanges array, the number of lines from the beginning of the file to the end of the sensitive data.

  • In an Occurrences.offsetRanges array, the number of characters from the beginning of the file to the end of the sensitive data.

  • In a Page object, the number of lines (lineRange) or characters (offsetRange) from the beginning of the page to the end of the sensitive data.
refs.Range$Start:
Possible values are:

  • In an Occurrences.lineRanges array, the number of lines from the beginning of the file to the beginning of the sensitive data.

  • In an Occurrences.offsetRanges array, the number of characters from the beginning of the file to the beginning of the sensitive data.

  • In a Page object, the number of lines (lineRange) or characters (offsetRange) from the beginning of the page to the beginning of the sensitive data.

refs.ClassificationResultStatus$Code:
The status of the finding. Possible values are:

  • COMPLETE - Amazon Macie successfully completed its analysis of the object that the finding applies to.

  • PARTIAL - Macie analyzed only a subset of the data in the object that the finding applies to. For example, the object is an archive file that contains files in an unsupported format.

  • SKIPPED - Macie wasn't able to analyze the object that the finding applies to. For example, the object is a malformed file or a file that uses an unsupported format.
refs.ClassificationResultStatus$Reason: A brief description of the status of the finding. Amazon Macie uses this value to notify you of any errors, warnings, or considerations that might impact your analysis of the finding.

The path, as a JSONPath expression, to the field in the record that contains the data. If Amazon Macie detects sensitive data in the name of any element in the path, Macie omits this field.

refs.ServiceQuotaExceededException$Message: The explanation of the error that occurred.
refs.SessionIssuer$AccountId: The unique identifier for the AWS account that owns the entity that was used to get the credentials.
refs.SessionIssuer$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source account, IAM user, or role that was used to get the credentials.
refs.SessionIssuer$PrincipalId: The unique identifier for the entity that was used to get the credentials.
refs.SessionIssuer$Type: The source of the temporary security credentials, such as Root, IAMUser, or Role.
refs.SessionIssuer$UserName: The name or alias of the user or role that issued the session. This value is null if the credentials were obtained from a root account that doesn't have an alias.
refs.SortCriteria$AttributeName: The name of the property to sort the results by. This value can be the name of any property that Amazon Macie defines for a finding.
refs.TagCriterionPairForJob$Key: The value for the tag key to use in the condition.
refs.TagCriterionPairForJob$Value: The tag value to use in the condition.
refs.TagScopeTerm$Key: The tag key to use in the condition.
refs.TagValuePair$Key: The value for the tag key to use in the condition.
refs.TagValuePair$Value: The tag value, associated with the specified tag key (key), to use in the condition. To specify only a tag key for a condition, specify the tag key for the key property and set this value to an empty string.
refs.TestCustomDataIdentifierRequest$Regex: The regular expression (regex) that defines the pattern to match. The expression can contain as many as 512 characters.
refs.TestCustomDataIdentifierRequest$SampleTe: The sample text to inspect by using the custom data identifier. The text can contain as many as 1,000 characters.
refs.ThrottlingException$Message: The explanation of the error that occurred.
refs.UnprocessedAccount$AccountId: The AWS account ID for the account that the request applies to.
refs.UnprocessedAccount$ErrorMessage: The reason why the request hasn't been processed.
refs.UpdateFindingsFilterRequest$Description:
A custom description of the filter. The description can contain as many as 512 characters.

We strongly recommend that you avoid including any sensitive data in the description of a filter. Other users might be able to see the filter's description, depending on the actions that they're allowed to perform in Amazon Macie.
refs.UpdateFindingsFilterRequest$Name:
A custom name for the filter. The name must contain at least 3 characters and can contain as many as 64 characters.

We strongly recommend that you avoid including any sensitive data in the name of a filter. Other users might be able to see the filter's name, depending on the actions that they're allowed to perform in Amazon Macie.
refs.UpdateFindingsFilterResponse$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the filter that was updated.
refs.UpdateFindingsFilterResponse$Id: The unique identifier for the filter that was updated.
refs.UsageRecord$AccountId: The unique identifier for the AWS account that the data applies to.
refs.UserIdentityRoot$AccountId: The unique identifier for the AWS account.
refs.UserIdentityRoot$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the principal that performed the action. The last section of the ARN contains the name of the user or role that performed the action.
refs.UserIdentityRoot$PrincipalId: The unique identifier for the entity that performed the action.
refs.UserPausedDetails$JobImminentExpirationH: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Health event that Amazon Macie sent to notify you of the job or job run's pending expiration and cancellation. This value is null if a job has been paused for less than 23 days.
refs.ValidationException$Message: The explanation of the error that occurred.

refs.ApiCallDetails$FirstSeen: The first date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when any operation was invoked and produced the finding.
refs.ApiCallDetails$LastSeen: The most recent date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the specified operation (api) was invoked and produced the finding.
refs.BatchGetCustomDataIdentifierSummary$Crea: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the custom data identifier was created.
refs.BucketMetadata$BucketCreatedAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the bucket was created.
refs.BucketMetadata$LastUpdated: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Macie most recently retrieved both bucket and object metadata from Amazon S3 for the bucket.
refs.CustomDataIdentifierSummary$CreatedAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the custom data identifier was created.
refs.DescribeClassificationJobResponse$Create: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job was created.
refs.DescribeClassificationJobResponse$LastRu: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job started. If the job is a recurring job, this value indicates when the most recent run started.
refs.Finding$CreatedAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the finding was created.
refs.Finding$UpdatedAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the finding was last updated. For sensitive data findings, this value is the same as the value for the createdAt property. All sensitive data findings are considered new (unique) because they derive from individual classification jobs.
refs.GetBucketStatisticsResponse$LastUpdated: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Macie most recently retrieved both bucket and object metadata from Amazon S3 for the buckets.
refs.GetCustomDataIdentifierResponse$CreatedA: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the custom data identifier was created.
refs.GetMacieSessionResponse$CreatedAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the Amazon Macie account was created.
refs.GetMacieSessionResponse$UpdatedAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, of the most recent change to the status of the Macie account.
refs.GetMemberResponse$InvitedAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when an Amazon Macie membership invitation was last sent to the account. This value is null if a Macie invitation hasn't been sent to the account.
refs.GetMemberResponse$UpdatedAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, of the most recent change to the status of the relationship between the account and the administrator account.
refs.Invitation$InvitedAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the invitation was sent.
refs.JobDetails$LastJobRunTime:
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job (lastJobId) started. If the job is a recurring job, this value indicates when the most recent run started.

This value is typically null if the value for the isDefinedInJob property is FALSE or UNKNOWN.
refs.JobSummary$CreatedAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job was created.
refs.Member$InvitedAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when an Amazon Macie membership invitation was last sent to the account. This value is null if a Macie invitation hasn't been sent to the account.
refs.Member$UpdatedAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, of the most recent change to the status of the relationship between the account and the administrator account.
refs.S3Bucket$CreatedAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the bucket was created.
refs.S3Object$LastModified: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the object was last modified.
refs.SessionContextAttributes$CreationDate: The date and time, in UTC and ISO 8601 format, when the credentials were issued.
refs.UsageRecord$FreeTrialStartDate: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the free trial started for the account.
refs.UserPausedDetails$JobExpiresAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job or job run will expire and be cancelled if you don't resume it first.
refs.UserPausedDetails$JobPausedAt: The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when you paused the job.
